pullRequest.body:
This defines the typeclass `ZeroLEClass` (alongside its multiplicative analog `OneLEClass`). This is intended as a mechanism to transfer convenient order theorems about `⊥` to the better behaved algebraic hierarchy (sort of how we did with [`SuccAddOrder`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/SuccPred.html#SuccAddOrder) a while back).

The previously most general `bot_eq_zero` lemma on [`CanonicallyOrderedAddCommMonoid`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/Monoid/Canonical/Defs.html#CanonicallyOrderedAddCommMonoid) was defined too late to be applicable on `Nat` and `Fin`, and was inapplicable to structures such as `Finsupp`, `Ordinal`, or `Nimber`. Now, all this lemma requires is `ZeroLEClass + OrderBot + PartialOrder`.

---

- ...

`+ isBot_one`

`- instance (priority := 100) canonicallyOrderedAddCommMonoid.toZeroLeOneClass`
`- ne_zero_of_lt`
`- zero_lt_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

pullRequest.title: refactor(Algebra/Order/ZeroLE): typeclass for `0` / `1` being a bottom element
